prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] Generate Sketch Generate a sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch will have two rectangular faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) with the following details: Face 1 Create a loop (loop\\_1) with 4 lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.125, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.125, 0.0], End Point [0.125, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.125, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Face 2 Create another loop (loop\\_1) with 4 lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.5925, 0.0], End Point [0.7175, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.7175, 0.0], End Point [0.7175, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.7175, 0.75], End Point [0.5925, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.5925, 0.75], End Point [0.5925, 0.0] Note: Both faces are rectangles and their sides are parallel to the coordinate system axes. Apply Scaling and Extrusion Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the generated sketch. Extrude the scaled sketch with the following parameters: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.25 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 Describe the Part This part represents a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The model is symmetrical along the central axis. The length, width, and height of the part are approximately 0.75, 0.25, and 0.75 units, respectively.</description>
